content: Call to Repent
Just at that time some people came who told Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate [the governor] had mixed with their sacrifices.
Jesus replied to them,   [change your old way of thinking, turn from your sinful ways and live changed lives],    [change your old way of thinking, turn from your sinful ways and live changed lives],
Parable of the Fig Tree
Then He  telling them this parable:   [depleting the soil and blocking the sunlight]?’  [just]
Healing on the Sabbath
Now Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
And there was a woman who for eighteen years had had an illness caused by a spirit (demon). She was bent double, and could not straighten up at all.
When Jesus saw her, He called her over and said to her,
Then He laid His hands on her; and immediately she stood erect again and she  glorifying  praising God.

But the leader of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath,  saying to the crowd in response, “There are six days in which work ought to be done; so come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day.”
But the Lord replied to him,
As He was saying this, all His opponents were being humiliated; and the entire crowd was rejoicing over all the glorious things that were being done by Him.
Parables of Mustard Seed and Leaven
So this led Him to say,
And again He said,
Teaching in the Villages
Jesus journeyed on through cities and villages, teaching and making His way toward Jerusalem.

And someone asked Him, “Lord, will only a few be saved [from the penalties of the last judgment]?” And He said to them,  [force aside unbelief and the attractions of sin];  [by their own works]   [again and again],  [for you are not of My household].’    [in sorrow and pain]  [in distress and anger]   [and feast at the table]
At that very hour some Pharisees came up and said to Him, “Leave and go away from here, because Herod [Antipas] wants to kill You.”
And He said to them,  [that sly, cowardly man],    [to death]  [messengers]  [by God]!  [around Me],   [abandoned by God and destitute of His protection];  [to be celebrated with praise]
